item.title: Building the MLOps Platform
item.description:
Building a platform from scratch is ultimately about standardization and developer experience.

The Problem

How do small companies go from scrappy startup to unicorn-level operations?

We all know the pattern: early-stage teams, especially in ML and DS, prioritize speed over robustness.
Ship features → hit deadlines → experiment fast. Best practices come later.

But what happens when the company starts raising bigger rounds, scaling operations, hiring dozens of new engineers, and introducing more requirements?

item.title: Engineering Culture & Leadership
item.description:
As the first ML Engineer in the region, I quickly adapted to the team and became one of the trusted voices in technical decision-making.

Bridging the Gap

Joining as the first engineer for LATAM, my initial goal was simple:
prove the level of software quality and delivery we could achieve from the region… and we did.

First Task: Deploying a Ray Serving PoC

My first assignment was to deploy a PoC using Ray Serve.
Not a bad starting point, especially considering that the long-term goal was to standardize all deployments on Kubernetes.
